title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots aim to set the NFL record for most Super Bowl wins with a seventh victory against the Seahawks.
A win would make Mike Vrabel the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both player and coach.
Patriots could achieve the greatest single-season turnaround by winning after a previous 4-13 record year.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs seeks to boost his Hall of Fame prospects with a Super Bowl LX win against the Seattle Seahawks.
The 32-year-old receiver has four Pro Bowls and two All-Pro nods, aiming for his first Super Bowl MVP.
Diggs ranks 38th in receiving yards, potentially moving into top 15 with a few more strong seasons.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former New England Patriots and Colts kicker, was named to the Pro Football Hall of Fame class of 2026.
Vinatieri scored the most points in NFL history, with 2,673 points over 24 seasons, and made 44 consecutive field goals.
He played a critical role in the Patriots' early 2000s success, winning three Super Bowls with crucial, last-second field goals.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel simulated a longer halftime during the Patriots' final practice for Super Bowl LX preparation.
Super Bowl halftime performer Bad Bunny's songs played as players spent 14 minutes in the locker room.
Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited in practice; Joshua Farmer remains questionable for the game.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Drake Maye and Sam Darnold will face off in Super Bowl LX, with ball security vital against defensive opponents.
Patriots' Milton Williams could play a key role, aiming to disrupt Sam Darnold and the Seahawks' offense.
Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba recorded 119 receptions for 1,793 yards during the season, posing a major threat to Patriots.

title: Mass. company pleads guilty to OSHA violation that led to employee’s death
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: John Oliveira & Sons Stamp Concrete, Inc. pled guilty to OSHA violations in an incident that killed Josué Tiquiram in 2023.
Tiquiram was crushed by a tail conveyor at an East Freetown worksite; no safety device was in place to prevent the accident.
The company may face up to five years probation, a $500,000 fine, and restitution; sentencing is on May 4.

title: Here’s what Healey put up in her Super Bowl bet with Washington state governor
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey wagered Dunkin', Legal Sea Foods clam chowder, lobster rolls, and oysters on the Patriots' Super Bowl win.
Washington Gov. Bob Ferguson promised to send shellfish and coffee if the Patriots defeat the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Gov. Healey declared the weekend New England Patriots Appreciation Weekend and plans to attend Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.

title: Woman convicted of fraud after living under a stolen identity for more than 20 years
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Lina Maria Orovio-Hernandez, 59, convicted of identity theft and fraud after using a stolen identity for over 20 years.
She illegally obtained $400,000 in federal benefits, including $260,000 in Section 8 assistance and $101,000 in SSDI.
Charges include aggravated identity theft, with sentences ranging from five to 10 years and possible deportation post-sentence.

title: Celtics rally from 22 down in Vucevic’s debut to beat Heat: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 11 points and grabbed 12 rebounds in his Celtics debut, aiding their comeback win over the Heat.
Payton Pritchard led a significant third-quarter rally with 19 points, helping the Celtics overcome a 22-point deficit.
Derrick White hit key three-pointers and played strong defense, contributing to the Celtics' 98-96 victory at TD Garden.

title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially declared neutrality regarding Patriots' Super Bowl LX participation, stirring fan backlash.
Brady later expressed support for Patriots' owner Robert Kraft on Instagram, wishing team a seventh ring.
Ex-teammates Vince Wilfork and current player Robert Spillane criticized Brady's lack of public Patriots' support.
